faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course is focused on following topics:
- Valuation theory: the time value of money, valuing of financial instruments. 
- Financing decisions: financial structure, cost of capital, financial leverage, capital structure theories (i.e. M&M propositions I and II), optimal capital structure theory, operating and financial leverage.
- Investment decision: asset structure formation, capital budgeting, project valuation. 
- Dividend decisions: dividend policy, dividend policy theories. 
- Working capital management: management of net working capital, inventory management, credit and receivables management, cash management. 
- Financial statement analysis: financial ratio analysis, financial planning.
- International aspects of financial management.
description.et:
Kursus keskendub järgmistele teemadele:
- Väärtusteooria: raha ajaväärtus, väärtpaberite väärtuse hindamine. 
- Finantseerimisotsused: finantsstruktuur, kapitali hind, finantsvõimendus, kapitalistruktuuri teooriad (nt M&M I ja II teoreem), optimaalse kapitalistruktuuri kujundamine, võimendusanalüüs. 
- Investeerimisotsused: varade struktuuri kujundamine, kapitali eelarvestamine, projekti väärtuse hindamine. 
- Dividendiotsused: dividendipoliitika kujundamine, dividenditeooriad. 
- Käibekapitali juhtimine: puhta käibekapitali juhtimine, varude juhtimine, debitoorse võlgnevuse juhtimine, sularaha juhtimine. 
- Finantsanalüüs: suhtarvuanalüüs, finantskavandamine.
- Finantsjuhtimise rahvusvahelised aspektid.

objectives.en: The aim is to provide fundamental knowledge about financial management of a company and main theoretical concepts related to financial management.
objectives.et: Õppeaine eesmärk on anda alusteadmisi ettevõtte finantsjuhtimist puudutavatest peamistest teoreetilistest kontseptsioonidest.

learning_outcomes.en: A student who has passed the course, has acquired basic knowledge about financial theories (including main terminology and concepts), formulas and their possible applications, and is able to apply those formulas to solve assignments (analyze cases) with given data on topics considered during the course.
learning_outcomes.et: Aine läbinud üliõpilane on omandanud baasteadmised rahandusteooriate (sh põhimõistete ja -kontseptsioonide), valemite ning nende võimalike rakenduste kohta ning oskab neid rakendada etteantud andmetega ülesannete lahendamisel/situatsioonide analüüsimisel aine raames käsitletud teemade lõikes.

independent_work.et: Two sets of Moodle-based home assignments are to be completed independently. Instructions and feedback will be shared and discussed on an ongoing basis. Additionally, students are required to complete an individual test and participate in the Corporate Finance Game.

description.et:
2 homework assignments (Moodle-based) - contain several practical financial management cases, given to solve at home. (10% x 2 = 20% of final grade)
- first part will be uploaded on 19.02.2025 - deadline 11.03.2025
- second part will be uploaded on 19.03.2025 - deadline 08.04.2025
Individual test: theoretical multiple-choice test questions and practical assignments (15% of final grade).

Participation in Corporate Finance Game (15% of final grade)
- Stage I (Auction): 04.03.2025
- Stage II (Contracts): 18.03.2025
- Stage III (Game): 23.04.2025

Individual final exam (in a classroom): a multiple-choice closed book test on theoretical questions and simple practical cases. Every question has only one correct answer option (50% of final grade)

Personal feedback will be provided during responsible instructor's office hours, it can be also provided via e-mail or Zoom/MS Teams/BBB on request

grade_evaluation.et:
A student has to collect at least 50.5 points from all the evaluation activities (home assignments, mid-term exam and final exam) to pass this course. A student does NOT have to collect 50.5% from each activity, the total score after the final exam will be taken into account.

This course ends with a differentiated assessment. Grades will be formed as follows:
less than 50.5 points - F
50.5-60.49 points -  E
60.5-70.49 points - D
70.5-80.49 points - C
80.5-90.49 points - B
90.5 and more - A

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Chair of International Business and Innovation

topic.et: (24 week) Introduction to subject. Main concepts of finance. Corporate governance (2 h)
(24 week) Introduction to subject. Main concepts of finance. Corporate governance (2 h)
(25 week) Valuation concept: time value of money, valuation of securities (2 h)
(25 week) Valuation concept: time value of money, valuation of securities (2 h)
(27 week) Computer class I + Corporate Finance Game, Stage I (4 h)
(29 week) Individual test + Corporate Finance Game, Stage II (2 h)
(31 week) Corporate failure and bankruptcy (Dr. Oliver Lukason) (2 h)
(33 week) International aspects of financial management (2 h)
(33 week) International aspects of financial management (2 h)
(34 week) Corporate Finance Game, Stage III & wrap-up (4 h)
